Reviews.Content: pretty cheap, pretty central I stayed in a single room which was very small. The hotel is somehow old. Breakfast is ok. People at the reception were nice. It is central and cheap compared to the average Florence accommodation.
Reviews.Author: dodischi

Reviews.Content: A great experience The Annalena is a gem, not quite in the very centre of Florence, but only 20 minutes walk from the station without luggage and five from the Ponte Vecchio. There are some steps to climb, (2 1/2 flights) but they are not steep and they are wide. Might be a problem for unfit or older people with heavy luggage though. We found it good value (only 275 Euros for three nights in a double superior room). The shower was in a bath so no problems with flooding like others have mentioned. Rooms have high ceilings and antique furniture and our balcony backed onto a private garden. One advantage of being a little away from the centre of Florence is that it is quieter than central hotels (though I dont think anywhere is completely quiet in Florence, particularly in August.) High ceilings and air conditioning make it bearable even in very hot weather such as we had.
Reviews.Author: morriselectrical

Reviews.Content: Pensione Annalena is a hidden gem to stay in Florence! A lovely little hotel on the 2nd floor of a converted Palace, with some rooms with a balcony terrace overlooking lovely gardens (great from breakfast!)Walking - 3 mins to Pitti Palace  Boboli Gardens, 10 mins to Ponte Vechio and central old cityGorgeous staff, stay and memories!
Reviews.Author: smokeyrasher

Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel The hotel was beautiful, full of unique art, and in a great location. It's three minutes from the Pitti Palace and Boboli Gardens, five minutes from Ponte Vecchio, and is very close to two bus lines. The hotel was quiet and had a great breakfast (included), but the best part by far was the staff. All staff members we were in contact with were friendly, helpful, and spoke great English. They allowed us to store our bags behind the desk for free for a whole day after we had checked out, and also helped us navigate the bus system. The only drawback is that there is no lift, which could be a problem if you have a lot of bags (we had a lot of bags, but didn't find it to be hugely detrimental). Also, my wife would have liked carpeting in the room, but I thought it added to the appeal because the floor was clean and had a very nice pattern. We weren't interested in wireless (which is available in each room) or watching tv (mostly Italian shows and poor reception), just in cleanliness, location, and staff, all of which were fantastic. We felt the price was good for the service and room, considering Florence is a very expensive city to stay in. I would certainly recommend Hotel Annalena to anyone, unless they cannot walk stairs.(My wife and I are a young couple with a 3 month old)
Reviews.Author: sjduluth

Reviews.Content: Decent Deal The place was a little hard to find because it was on the second floor of a larger building up three flights of stairs, but overall it was a simple, nice and clean facility. There was not an elevator, so if you find it difficult to walk up three flights of stairs this is not the place for you. The place was a little pricey, but for Florence that is to be expected. The staff was friendly and the continental breakfast was simple but good. I would recommend this facility to a friend and would consider staying here again myself.
Reviews.Author: Stephanie_007

Reviews.Content: Decent hotel in a quiet part of Florence Paid 120 Euro for a double room. It is worth checking out the room before you commit to it, the first room showed to us (rm 14) was terrible, the washroom was just awful. Then the next room shown to us was entirely different and much better. The ceilings are high and arched and the furniture is old and gives much character.Breakfast is included.Location is okay, it is in the south part of Florence and about a 15 minute walk to the central part.If you have the time or have a rental car, it is worth taking the windy street above the Boboli gardens for a fantastic view over the city. wow!
Reviews.Author: JandMToronto

Reviews.Content: Nice and decent The hotel (actually is a pensione) is close to Pitti Palace and the Boboli Gardens, but quite far from the old city (as far as far can mean in an old city, where you can walk the whole area in about 35-40 min :-))A little bit unpleasent to reach, since the bus route (from the train station) is on Via dei Serragli. Since I only took the bus once, my guess is that the best stop is the 3rd stop on via dei Serragli and then walk to via Romana and look for the numbers on the houses, to see if you turn left or right. Or, just to make sure, you can take the bus till the last stop on Via dei Serragli (where you can see a roman gate) and then go back and walk on the via Romana, till you find Annalena (note: it's on the first floor of an old building).Although everything is quite old (including the plumbing - which can be a problem - it's noisy, if it's used in the middle of the night), the room is clean and the towels and sheets are changed everyday. Breakfast it's satiable, which is all that matters.
Reviews.Author: gabip

Reviews.Content: Average hotel with good service Hotel in old monastery with some simple frescoes. Quiet simple rooms to the garden, but no access for the guests. Good location near the Ponte Vecchio and kind service. Price acceptable (120 euro for a double room).
Reviews.Author: Assistant-Professor

Reviews.Content: Pity about the steps This hotel/pension is in the old part of Florence inside the city walls on a narrow street opposite the Boboli Gardens and near the Pitti Palace of the Medici. A little further on is the Ponte Vecchio.We stayed here for 2 nights in May 2007 and the greatest shock was the flight of 25+ stone steps we had to negotiate with our luggage, this was not mentioned on the hotel website. A building with such an ancient history, going all the way back to the Medicis, may be very restricted on what updating is permitted. However, a removable heavyweight triangular slope on each step should be considered, would not detract from the character of the building and be of great assistance to the traveller with heavy luggage. The shower area had a flat base without sides with the result that the whole floor got wet after use. The room and bedding were clean and the beds comfortable, the breakfast was adequate. The reception area had a TV, comfortable seating, a selection of Guide books on Florence which could be borrowed, all the staff were friendly and helpful.
Reviews.Author: wanderer99Mcr

Reviews.Content: Ok, but expensive It's a normal hotel, clean nice staff but expensive. I'd stayed there for a conference and Florence has much to see so only sleep there. The good things: clean, quiet (room 14 at the back), ok breakfast, great staff, air conditioning (it really was hot). Not so good: tiny bathroom, access (2 levels of stairs caring your bags).overall was a nice stay but expensive for what it was, hey but Florence it's expensive!
Reviews.Author: PAXD

Reviews.Content: Quiet, peaceful, lovely Hotel Annalena Pensione Annalena -- Hotel Annalena, was a convent and girls school at one time. It has been turned into a lovely, peaceful, spacious hotel. They have a huge, inviting lounge and bar area in the main lobby. There are some stairs to climb but they are broad and easy. There are large, modern bathrooms with plenty of hot water in the big tub/shower combo. My husband and I stayed there for 3 nights in early October 2006. We had been in Rome before that and our room at Pensione Annalena was so quiet compared to Rome. It is located behind the Boboli Garden. Our huge French window opened onto a secluded garden/greenhouse area. All I we could hear were birds singing. It was wonderful! Our room was huge and the bed had a good mattress and one of the softest blankets I have ever felt. Clean, crisp sheets every day. Wonderful thick towels, too. The furnishings were very pretty. We were on the other side of the Arno River from all the museums but still within a short walk of the bridges. We walked everywhere easily from our hotel. The only taxi we took was to get back to the train station. The breakfast was large, with a good variety, and there was delicious coffee made any way you liked it. The staff was very friendly and helpful and always wanted to know how our day had been and what we had seen. The taxi they called for came in less than 2 minutes! We hated to leave! We would definately stay there again!
Reviews.Author: Birdie2

Reviews.Content: Good Location Good Room I decided to weigh in after seeing that there was only one awful review of the Annalena posted on this site. True, it's up two flights of stairs. The room we had, however, was a huge lovely room, more than adequate for my husband, myself and our teen, with high ceilings and big double doors that opened onto the terrace overlooking the garden. We had our complimentary and quite good coffee and breakfast on the terrace there. The bathroom was excellent and altogether we enjoyed our stay. Walking distance to museums etc but far enough away from the city center to have a little peace and quiet. The Annalena is across from a beautiful -- really beautiful -- garden connected with a famous palace -- this was a few years ago, and I've forgotten the name of the palace! But it's in all the guide books. Ask for one of the terrace rooms upstairs. Maybe some small rooms downstairs are not so good. Ours was excellent, however, and the price was good for Florence. I would stay there again. Service nothing to die for. And YES you do carry your own luggage.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Only if you are desperate.... Keep looking!! Unless you are desperate, find another hotel!! This is a very expensive version of a youth hostel that you might have bunked in when you were 20 years old.Pensionne Annalena is very stark. This is a converted convent, but there wasn't much of a conversion!The bathroom was TINY....and there was no shower base, so the water ran back behind the toilet. The step UP into the bathroom was a menace for my elderly mother.We met some wonderful people staying here...mostly Americans and Brits. Breakfast was OK....just the basics, but the conversation with other patrons was lively and fun.Our triple did have 3 beds and a lovely terrace which we found somewhat ridiculous: the only access was by stepping out the window, which was NOT at a low enough level to provide easy navigation. The lovely garden was not at all lovely, and could only be considered a garden by stretching your imagination.The front desk people were fabulous, however. We really liked them, and they seemed somewhat horrified by our concerns (our mother's safety in the bathroom, for one....) The hotel was fully booked, but they did offer the use of a family apartment which was basically a 2 bedroom apartment with a bathroom. We declined, as we were unwilling to pack up and move all our luggage down a treacherous internal staircase for one night, then back up and down the main staircase to the street (see below).ALSO, you need to know that the hotel reception desk (don't call it a lobby...) is 2 1/2 LONG flights of stairs from the street. THERE IS NO LIFT EVEN FOR LUGGAGE....YOU WILL PULL IT ALL UP THERE YOURSELF.Keep looking....you can do much better!
Reviews.Author: migolfergirl

Reviews.Content: relax cortesia e simpatia all hotel annalena       il terrazino della mia camera
Reviews.Author: pepito_gonzales
